channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Cattle ruining path, 1st January
item.description:
Around the meadows there is a footpath. Where this bottlenecks between theeadows each path becomes boggy and impassable due to the cattle trampling the ground. This is whilst it's been dry and as soons as it rains these will turn intoassive puddles making the issue worse like last year. Some further soil, stones or some sort of crossing is needed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Marten Close, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unsafe double rim--more likely to hit hand/head, 1st January
item.description:
Having experienced this first hand, a second rim lower than the standard rim (10ft) increases the risk of injury. If you were to jump high enough, it is unnatural for a second rim to be there while playing basketball. Instead, there should be a single rim (potentially with net) for safer use of the court. Issue has been present since the court opened.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barnwood Road, Barnwood, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The potholes that were supposed to be fixed are in fact not fixed at all. One pothole has been filled in. There are multiple more potholes that need filling as a matter of urgency, 1st January
item.description:
The potholes start from the junction of Blaisdon Way, all the way to the junction of Pilgrove Way. The road goes past Hayden Road Allotments. The potholes have been there for around a few month and have been getting worse. Multiple cars are having to swerve all over the road to avoid damaging their tyres. Some cars are even driving on the other side of the road to avoid them all. They all need filling in or even better, the road needs resurfacing altogether.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayden Road, Hesters Way, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Firework rubbish in park, 1st January
item.description:
A family group was witnessed making this mess in the park on NYE. They left it smouldering but it has fortunately now been extinguished. They have left a lot of rubbish and firework detritus. Since this is a park used extensively by dog-walkers, could this please be cleared up? Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Holmer Crescent, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: The gate was tied with a knot we could not undo so I cut it out. But the gate lock area was deliberately infilled with thorny bush offcuts we had to cut out first. It was a deliberate act to prevent access., 31st December
item.description:
The gate that leads out of the field next to the chicken farm was deliberately covered with thorny branches.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ashchurch Rural, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Request to put yellow lines on Shakespeare road to help bus route, 31st December
item.description:
At the moment there is no yellow lines on the side of Shakespeare road before the junction with Tennyson Road at the shops. As a result the bus which travels down Shakespeare road and turns left onto Tennyson Road can be blocked by cars when they double park. This happens often because of people visiting the shops from out of the area. The trouble with this is that local residents who know not to block the bus route by parking on the opposite side end up being asked to move their vehicle. If you put yellow lines at the end of Shakespeare before the crossing with Tennyson on the left hand side of the road nearest the copper beech tree this would solve the problem.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 31, Shakespeare Road, St Mark's, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
